Articles.Content:
Windows Store Installer Install 64-bit

Approx 25min into the game, switched from KSC to VAB. Windows APPCRASH window appears, KSP does not recover. Nothing unusual noted prior to crash.

error.txt http://pastebin.com/23rqTiux

output_log.txt http://pastebin.com/ihqwFS5V

Windows Crash Log http://pastebin.com/VJJTvbMF

 

Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit (6.1, Build 7601)

AMD FX(tm)-8350 Eight-Core-Processor

16384MB RAM

DirectX 11

AMD Radeon HD 7900 4095 MB  1920 x 1080 (32 bit) (60hz)

AMD Control Center for KSP: Use application settings for all items

Mods:

StockVisualEnhancements_0.6.2-HR

Scatterer 0.0244

CryoEngine 0_2_1

KerbalAtomics 0_2_0

PlanetShine-0.2.5

RCSBuildAid_v0.7.7-14-g74c9da7

RealPlume-StockConfigs_v0.10.4

InterstellarFuelSwitch_1.21

Edited April 21, 2016 by Raideur Ng

Your crash log shows you running KSP_x64.exe but you have uploaded the output_log.txt file from the 32bit version (which is showing an out-of-memory crash).  For the 64bit KSP you need to get the output_log.txt file from the KSP_x64_Data folder instead of KSP_Data.

Edit: also, in the 32bit log there is a huge amount of log spam being generated, apparently by Scatterer...

Edited April 21, 2016 by Padishar

Oops. I'll upload the proper log. Yes, Scatterer does produce a lot of log spam sadly, likely because they are actively working on solutions to several issues. If required, I can remove it and see if this crops up.

That new log has a big chunk missing from the middle.  It would be better to upload the whole file to a file sharing site rather than using pastebin.

The only thing I can see that is (a little) concerning is that CloudsManager is doing an awful lot of stuff on scene changes (and various other -Manager objects to a lesser extent).  I presume these are all part of StockVisualEnhancements so you could try removing that and see if the behaviour changes...
